data.title: Tell Your Friends
data.text:
Went to Bomba for dinner. New french oriented menu for fine dining. Very small, maybe seating for 12-16 people. Excellent selection of wines. Some of us had the 4 course dinner, Bordeaux, which included a lobster bisque (broth, not cream) and a large veal chop. Others had the lamb chops and the chicken. Every, yes, every dish was excellent.
Our server, Ike, was very helpful and enjoyed talking with him. 
The owner needs to update the restaurant website because it does not mention the new offerings and has the restaurant closing at 4:00 PM (we were there at 6:30 PM.)
Tell your friends and go there yourself.

data.title: Delightful change to normal fare; a little European
data.text:
Hours are not accurately indicated here. They are open for dinner,,, not sure of the hours.

An intimate restaurant on a busy corner...I give a place a couple tries before I make a statement.  This place has a PERSONALITY... Many restaurants in Asheville have gone on autopilot and gotten pricey with the demand that is here.  Chef Hector and his staff have two other successful restaurants and this little gem seems to be his current love.  Never will you feel rushed and, at least for now, small adjustments to the dish for personal or dietary restrictions are totally acceptable.  The wait staff couldn't have been more attentive.  They are learning the wine menu; which, will not extensive, is more than adequate.  Please give them a try or two.  I  will continue to see what is in store.

data.title: The most delicious thing I've ever eaten!
data.text: Stumbled upon this cute corner cafe on the edge of the art scene in Asheville. I had a cup of coffee and a breakfast arepa--a cornmeal pancake stuffed with egg, cheese and avocado along with some very fresh salsa. It was the most delicious thing I've ever eaten. A perfect start to a day of exploring the Blue Ridge Parkway.

data.title: Delicious sandwiches
data.text: Myself and my husband came upon this deli and decided to eat here as it had outside seating.  We ordered two sandwiches and a beer each, the food was delicious although it was huge! We could only eat half each and we took the other half home for later.  It was so good, we really enjoyed it.  The place is charming, outdoor seating comfortable and shaded and service was wonderful.  I wish I lived in Asheville to re-visit this lovely shop.

data.title: Horrible Service
data.text: This was the slowest service I have ever had. With four people in front of me I waited 10 mins to even get to the counter. Then it was 3 minutes past 11:00 and they said no more breakfast. Yeah right out of Big Daddy. Then I waited another 15 mins for my drink order. They has one girl working the grill and one girl working the counter. Horrible business model!  Too many other places to go to ever wait in line here!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: We had a great time! My family and I were passing through and all of our food was absolutely delicious! The Arepas are awesome. It is a small place though, so you won't be able to go with a large party. We are a family of 4 and we felt a little cramped. But the food was great, came out pretty quick, and I definitely appreciate their eco-friendliness!

data.title: Great cafe with expanding menu
data.text: I love this little place, in fact I love all of Hector Diaz restaurants. This was a great choice for me and my dog to be able to sit outside and for me to enjoy a delicious arepa dish. The food is so delicious, the service is great, everyone is so friendly, great coffee. They can do so much in such tight places. I am always so impressed. You simply must try it for a wonderfully easy patio dining experience right across from Pack Place.

data.title: Why bother?
data.text: OK, being from Asheville, I understand the downtown service attitude in the middle of tourist season, but this was horrific. Service was not only slow but delivered with hostility. I had met up with a good friend there to plan an event and got there early so, I ordered some coffee and sat on the patio to wait on my friend. Upon her arrival, she ordered eggs and bacon (which came out burnt and incorrect). When I went inside, I waited in line for about 20 minutes while the couple in front of me placed and paid for their order. When I stepped up to the counter, I was told that the line out the door had gotten there before me and that I needed to move (even though I watched every single person arrive well after I came back in). I can appreciate the preventative line cutting implementation but I really did not understand the hostility with which it was delivered to me. I left there starving and with a full bladder (due to receiving no food, or bathroom key and not getting to order). I will NEVER go back and I will be discouraging everyone I know to do the same. Its a shame that Bomba is in such a prime location and the concept is unique. As far as I am concerned, they can LA BOMBA right out of town.

data.title: Great location and friendly services
data.text: We had lunch here and their Salmon sandwich was good. my son wanted french fries and they were able to make me small bowl of french fries. Kuddos to them for letting me order something off the menu.

data.title: The unexpected
data.text: Great great sandwiches only thing is that if you go back again, and order the same sandwich it will be completely different. Personally I like consistency, so that I can look forwards to what I'm ordering. However, if you are visiting, this is always a great place to stop for a bite. If you like strong coffee, this is the place.

data.title: TERRIBLE SERVICE, Would NEVER recommend to a friend.
data.text:
In a quick summary: great location, nice background music from the street musicians, interesting menu, but HORRIBLE, ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE service by the Spanish Girl at the moment. 

We walk in, take a table and send my wife in to other first as I stay at the table with the Dog, when I come back, the girl has the most terrible attitude, pushing me in a way to order what ever . I ask what is the problem and she tell me "we are closing but it's ok, it's all about the money, and this is more money " .. I felt offended, as a costumer or a person. Either way I decided to try the food.  I then order water and basically tells me to get the free water from the jar with a very displeasing manner.  

Maybe it was a personal thing (I wouldn't know why) but it ruined my lunch .

Food quality: ehh, OK. I've tried better Arepas other places, not that bad. 

Will never come back

data.title: Gathering place for tourists and locals alike.  See and be seen.
data.text: Fast paced coffee shop smack dab in the middle of all that is Asheville.  You'll see locals, celebrities, wannabes and more.  Great selection of drinks.  I have not had food there but everything looks/smells good.  Place is very clean but small.  Outdoor dining area is great but just sitting in the window, drinking coffee while people watching is FUN!

data.title: Great food! Great service!
data.text: Great small quaint place to grab breakfast or lunch.  The service was very nice and it's right in the downtown area.

data.title: GREAT FOOD!
data.text: We stopped in at Bomba for lunch and were blown away by the delicious and creative dishes on offer. We got half chicken and ceviche plates and were especially impressed by the latter dish- the fish was tangy, fresh and flavorful and served in good-sized chunks with a fresh salad and plantains. The chicken was well-seasoned and juicy. Service was relatively slow, but not bad at all considering there was only one (genius) cook and a fairly large lunchtime crowd. Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Delicious, modern Spanish food
data.text: We happened to stop here for brunch on a Sunday because most of the traditional brunch restaurants downtown had 45+min waits. Bomba is bistro-style so we were able to order immediately. We had the falafel, guacamole, butternut squash soup, roasted pork pita, and Bomba BLT arepa. Everything was delicious!!

data.title: Never open
data.text: I was killing some time on December 13th and decided to drop by Bomba to do it at 4 pm.   They were supposed to be open till 5 by their hours on the door but they had bolted the door.   This is the 2nd time I've caught them refusing business during regular business hours. This place is starved for business so I just don't understand  why they would do this. Won't try again,  looking forward to their impending demise.

data.title: The food saved it from a 2 because the service was pretty bad
data.text: We ordered some tacos for us and bagels for the kids at lunch. 35 min later we got the bagels and 10 minutes after that we finally got the tacos. They didn't seem very concerned by the delay and weren't that busy. Luckily the wait was somewhat worth it because the tacos were great, but not quite hat great. Won't be back.

data.title: It Goes to show you that size doesn't.......
data.text:
Matter. I mean the place is literally a tiny place in the corner of two main streets very very tight. But the food oh my, Arepas are an absolute most. And sunny farm 44 tacos are also a must. Don't leave without trying the Arepas you won't regret it I promise. I love how the this pace infuses South and Central American flavors to bring about quite an experience. 

Bon appetite!!!

data.title: Great coffee in the center of it all
data.text: We stopped in for coffee in the late evening after walking around downtown for a while. The barista quickly prepared our espressos and brought them to us outside on the patio. The place was empty except for us on a weeknight, and the patio is right on the corner of Patton and Biltmore across from the Vance monument, so there are street performers and people passing by. We had a lovely time sitting in the shadows watching it all go by while enjoying some excellent coffee.

data.title: Underappreciated Asheville spot!
data.text: Really awesome menu selections. All the food is delicious and low on grease, etc. Their burritos are great!
